NRTAPmodel 0.1.0

    • Spatiotemporal cross validation types
    • Downloading EPA Daily Data

    Generate spatio-temporal cross-validation index

    generate_cv_index.Rd

    Generate spatio-temporal cross-validation index

    generate_cv_index(
  covars,
  cv_mode = c("lolo", "loto", "lolto", "random", "lblo", "lbto", "lblto"),
  cv_fold = 5L,
  sp_fold = NULL,
  t_fold = NULL,
  blocks = NULL,
  block_id = NULL
)

    Arguments

    covars

    stdt. See convert_stobj_to_stdt for details.

    cv_mode

    character(1). One of 'lolo (leave-one-location-out)', 'loto (leave-one-time-out)', 'lolto (leave-one-location-time-out)', 'lblo (leave-block-location-out)', 'lbto (leave-block-time-out)', 'lblto (leave-block-location-time-out)' 'random (full random selection)'

    cv_fold

    integer(1). Number of folds for cross-validation.

    sp_fold

    integer(1). Number of subfolds for spatial blocks.

    t_fold

    integer(1). Number of subfolds for temporal blocks.

    blocks

    integer(2)/sf/SpatVector object.

    block_id

    character(1). The unique identifier of each block.

    Value

    A numeric vector with length of the number of input rows

    Details

    blocks is NULL as default (i.e., no block structure is considered); then "lb*" cv_mode is not working. blocks should be one of integer vector (length 2), sf, sftime, or SpatVector object. Please be advised that we cannot provide error messages related to the blocks type invalidity due to the cyclometric complexity. If any valid object is assigned here, cv_fold will not make sense and be ignored. Definition of unit grid (horizontal, vertical) size, arbitrary shape of blocks (sf/SpatVector case) where users can consider common spatial hierarchies such as states, counties, hydrological unit code areas, etc. lblto mode will accept sp_fold and t_fold. The maximum of results in this case is sp_fold * t_fold.

    Author

    Insang Song

    Contents

    Developed by Kyle Messier, Insang Song, Eva Marques, Mitchell Manware, Daniel Zilber, Anisha Singh, Lara Clark, Cavin Ward-Caviness.
